column4: but when he turns on the laptop nothing comes up on the screen, so i am not even sure it will boot off the CD
I suppose the driver could have corrupted the bios, but that's very surprising...
and quite rare. I wonder if he's had a hardware failure that just happened to coincide with what you did. LCDs do lose their backlights you know...
well, restarting does stress the hardware. If he power-cycled it, that's when most electronics dies...
first thing to try is to power off, wait a minute, then power on again and see if it comes back...
i asked and he said he did that a couple of times
black screen (backlight failure) is one of the commonest failure modes for laptops...
I don't understand. How can he tell his HD isn't responding if his monitor doesn't work?
maybe you need to get him some local help. He sounds confused...
nanotube: mechtech: he's telling me that nothing happens when he turns it on, nothing at all
and check the power supply etc...
he's probably really stressed right now. Try again tomorrow...
yeah, he is, he's gonna leave it like that for tomorrow and just give it another try
